title: Maria Andreeva, wife of a Russian soldier: 'I blame myself for not having been able to hold him back'
summary: This young mother has become the figurehead of a small but tenacious protest movement in Moscow calling for the return of thousands of men sent to fight in Ukraine.

title: Sarkozy sentenced to six months in prison for campaign overspending
summary: A lower court had sentenced the former French president to one year in prison for illegal campaign financing during his 2012 re-election bid.

title: Israeli bombs are wiping out Gaza's heritage and history
summary: Since the October 7 attacks, more than 200 cultural and historical sites have been partially or totally destroyed, according to an NGO report.

title: How is obtaining French nationality different in overseas Mayotte?
summary: To become French, a child born in the Indian Ocean territory has to meet different conditions than a child born in mainland France.

title: Kansas City Super Bowl parade shooting leaves at least one dead, 21 injured
summary: Kansas City police said in a news release that three armed people were taken into custody. Fans were urged to exit the area as quickly as possible.

title: Champions League: PSG secures a decisive 2-0 win against Real Sociedad
summary: Kylian Mbappé scored the opening goal and Bradley Barcola added the second, leading PSG to victory in the first leg of the round of 16 match on Wednesday.

title: US House Intelligence Committee chair warns of a serious national security threat
summary: Republican lawmaker Michael Turner, without providing details, urged the Biden administration to declassify information about what he described as a serious national security threat.

title: Why did Donald Trump accuse NATO members of not paying?
summary: The former US president has created confusion between direct NATO funding and allies' military spending, which is supposed to represent at least 2% of their GDP.

title: How is obtaining French nationality different in overseas Mayotte?
summary: To become French, a child born in the Indian Ocean territory has to meet different conditions than a child born in mainland France.

title: War in Ukraine: Front line situation 'extremely difficult' as Ukraine waits on aid
summary: Oleksandr Syrsky, Ukraine's new army chief, assessed the country's defense as 'extremely complex,' as the US Congress stalls on military aid. Meanwhile, Kyiv claimed to have destroyed a Russian warship off Crimea.

title: Greece could become first Orthodox-majority country to legalize same-sex marriage
summary: The vote of the law by Greek MPs would be a small revolution in a society where the weight of the Orthodox Church is still very strong.

title: The chaos of the snow-covered E22 route, a symbol of 'real Sweden'
summary: For over 24 hours in early January, a thousand vehicles were stranded on a road in southern Sweden, as no one dared to take control of the situation.

title: French court drops rape case against interior minister
summary: Gérald Darmanin had been accused by Sophie Patterson-Spatz of raping her in 2009. He was never charged in the case.

title: French PM Attal warns rail workers planning weekend strike
summary: 'Working is a duty,' Prime Minister Gabriel Attal declared ahead of a planned strike by SNCF national rail company workers, which would cancel one in two trains on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, February 16-18.

title: Argentina's Milei takes aim at the 'traitors' who scuppered his mega-bill
summary: Failing to win their support, the Argentine president engaged in a showdown with central deputies and provincial governors.

title: NATO chief says 18 states out of 31 will hit military spending target this year
summary: Jens Stoltenberg also reiterated his warning to Trump not to 'undermine' NATO's collective security in relation to Russia.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Israeli army launches air raids on Lebanon after rocket fire
summary: The raids, which targeted several locations some 10 to 25 kilometers from the Israeli-Lebanese border and have killed at least 4, came after a rocket fired from Lebanon injured several people and killed an Israeli soldier in northern Israel.

title: Paris booksellers: Macron to the rescue
summary: The open-air bookshops set up along the banks of the Seine will not have to move during the opening ceremony of the Paris Olympic Games.

title: Indonesia: Prabowo Subianto takes office in the shadow of outgoing president Jokowi
summary: The former commander of the special forces under Suharto's dictatorship has won the support of the current head of state, Joko Widodo, who is convinced he is best placed to continue his major projects of transforming Indonesia.

title: Germany overtakes Japan as third-biggest economy
summary: The change in positions primarily reflects the sharp fall in the yen against the dollar, which slumped by almost a fifth in 2022 and 2023 against the US currency, including around 7% last year.

title: Gaza: Concern mounts over French archaeological institution's collection
summary: A storeroom belonging to the French Biblical and Archaeological School in Jerusalem, located in Gaza, was raided by Israeli soldiers in January. The fate of these antiquities is cause for concern as the war continues.

title: UNESCO counts 341 cultural sites damaged in Ukraine after two years of war
summary: Based on satellite images, the UN agency estimates the damage in the sector at €3.3 billion.

title: Simone Biles en route to the Paris Olympics: 'I'm getting old and I have more to lose'
summary: In mid-January, Le Monde met the most decorated gymnast of all time in Spring, Texas. After she was suddenly unable to perform her sport during the Tokyo Olympics, she is preparing for the Paris Games in July.

title: 'For Republicans, compromise is treason because Democrats are not an opposition but enemies of the homeland'
summary: Ahead of the US presidential election, politicians loyal to Donald Trump have been obstructing on every issue, from immigration to aid to Ukraine, to boost his campaign, says columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Macron declares Badinter will be inducted to Panthéon, in agreement with family
summary: On Wednesday, the French president led a national tribute to former justice minister Robert Badinter, who championed the abolition of the death penalty in France.

title: Prabowo Subianto, Indonesia's new president, an ex-military man with a shady past
summary: Indonesia's new leader has been accused of crimes related to the bloody repression of East Timorese resistance fighters during the 1980s, and of abducting and torturing pro-democracy activists in 1998.

title: Every Thursday, the Comédie-Française puts stage costumes up for sale
summary: Since January 18, the Parisian theater has been offering around 30 second-hand items a week.

title: Israel blocks food aid destined for Gaza at the Port of Ashdod
summary: The 1,049 stalled containers were intended to feed the Gazans trapped around Rafah and who are currently threatened by famine.

title: Macron and Zelensky to sign bilateral security deal
summary: The French presidency announced that the deal, to be signed Friday at the Elysée, was part of 'commitments' to provide Ukraine with long-term security assistance.

title: Google AI research hub set to open in Paris
summary: The new institute will host at least 300 researchers, the French government said.

title: Microsoft announces €3.2 billion investment in Germany
summary: The financing will focus on 'AI and data center infrastructre,' the tech giant said.

title: UK economy enters recession
summary: Gross domestic product shrank 0.3% in the fourth quarter of 2023 after contracting 0.1% in the prior three months.

title: SpaceX launches 'Odysseus' moon lander for historic lunar mission
summary: The privately built moon lander launched into space atop a SpaceX rocket on Thursday. Developed by Intuitive Machines, it's hoped to be the first commercially built spacecraft to land on the lunar surface.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Israeli army enters Nasser Hospital in Khan Yunis
summary: Thousands of people displaced by fighting elsewhere remain at the hospital in southern Gaza, where the Israeli army said it was searching for hostages.

title: 'Donald Trump has gone from being a symptom of the crisis afflicting American society to a driving force'
summary: The danger posed by a return to the White House by the former president, despite the legal proceedings against him, is very real, warns Reed Brody, a former New York State assistant attorney general.

title: #StoryKillers, one year later: Shady middlemen are at the heart of French probe
summary: Le Monde, Forbidden Stories and partner media published a series of revelations into foreign interference in 2023. One year on, a vast judicial procedure has unraveled the workings of these influence campaigns in France.

title: #StoryKillers: The French lobbyist with many faces
summary: Jean-Pierre Duthion is a key player in a far-reaching judicial procedure on foreign interference, led by French investigators and launched after the revelations of the 'Story Killers' project.
